citation.article-title: Aequorivita gen. nov., a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from terrestrial and marine Antarctic habitats.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aequorivita (Ae.quo.ri.vi'ta. L. neut. n. aequor the flat surface of the sea; L. fem. n. vita life ; N.L. fem. n. Aequorivita life (living being) at the sea surface)
Cells are non-motile, Gram-negative rods or filaments that occur singly or in pairs.
Gas vesicles and helical or ring-shaped cells are not formed.
Metabolism is strictly aerobic and chemoheterotrophic.
Strains possess orange or yellow carotenoid pigments, but flexirubin pigments are absent.
Strains may require sodium ions for growth and require yeast extract when grown in defined mineral-salts media.
Psychrotolerant, with growth occurring between -2 and 25°C: optimal growth at about 20°C but no growth at 30°C (on agar media).
Major fatty acids are i15:1ω10c, a15:1ω10c, a15:0, i15:0, i16:1ω6c, i17:1ω5c, a17:1ω7c and 3-OH i16:0.
Member of the family Flavobacteriaceae, order Cytophagales.
The type species is Aequorivita antarctica.
